home.name: Ayman Orkhis
home.description: Third-year general engineering student at Télécom SudParis, specializing in AI and Data Science. Passionate about machine learning, deep learning, NLP, and computer vision. Experienced in research and applied AI development, with projects ranging from medical image segmentation to language models.

about.title: About Me
about.quote: ❝ The only way to do great work is to love what you do. ❞
about.name: Ayman Orkhis
about.bio1: I am an AI & Data Science engineering student in my 3rd year at Télécom SudParis, currently pursuing a Master's in Data Science at École Polytechnique. I have a strong foundation in mathematics, machine learning, deep learning, NLP, and computer vision, with hands-on experience in Python, SQL, and frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn.
about.bio2: Through my previous internships and projects, I applied these skills to impactful challenges: medical image segmentation with advanced architectures (Mamba & MedNeXt), the development of language models for Indigenous languages of Canada using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and predictive real-estate modeling at Avito.ma. In each of these, I distinguished myself as a key contributor, with several works recognized by awards and prizes.
about.bio3: Autonomous, rigorous, and results-driven, I value clean code, reproducible experiments, and teamwork. I am fluent in French and English, strengthened by international experiences that enhanced my adaptability and cross-cultural collaboration.

skillsSection.title: My Skills

items.company: ILLS Lab (Mila) – ÉTS | Montreal, QC, Canada
bullets: Developed a chatbot for Indigenous languages of Canada
Integrated local data and built a RAG system
Monitored/evaluated EDI policies via retrieval-augmented generation
Presented at the Ashukan Institute on AI-related biases and harms

items.role: Head of Research & AI Team Member
bullets: Organized monthly trainings on advanced AI applications
Tech watch and scoping of internal mini-projects
Presented and popularized recent AI research papers to the community
Apartment price prediction using Linear Regression, Random Forest, and XGBoost
EDA and feature engineering (location, area, amenities) on large Avito datasets
Preprocessing: missing values, encoding, normalization; scikit-learn pipelines
Evaluation with RMSE/R² and +75% accuracy vs. baselines
Visualized results (Matplotlib, Seaborn) and delivered recommendations
